info.title: DisplaySettings API
info.description: The `DisplaySetting` plugin provides an interface for display information such as current video resolution, supported video displays, zoom setting, sound mode, and much more.

audioDelay.summary: Delay (in ms) on the selected audio port

audioDelayOffset.summary: Delay offset (in ms) on the selected audio port

supportedAudioFormat.summary: A list of supported audio formats

items.example: `NONE`, `PCM`, `DOLBY AC3`, `DOLBY EAC3`, `DOLBY AC4`, `DOLBY MAT', 'DOLBY TRUEHD', 'DOLBY EAC3 ATMOS', 'DOLBY TRUEHD ATMOS', 'DOLBY MAT ATMOS', 'DOLBY AC4 ATMOS'

supportedVideoFormat.summary: A list of supported Video formats

audioPort1.summary: Audio port name (`HDMI0`, `SPEAKER0`, `SPDIF0`, and so on). The default port is `HDMI0` if no port is specified.

bassBoost.summary: Value between 0 and 100, where 0 means no bass boost (disabled) and 100 means max bass boost

boost.summary: Value between 0 and 96, where 0 means no boost and 96 means maximum boost

mode.summary: Enables or disables volume leveling (`0` = off, `1` = on, `2` = auto)

compressionLevel.summary: Value between 0 and 10, where 0 means no compression and 10 means maximum compression

connectedVideoDisplays.summary: A string [] of connected video display port names

dolbyVolumeMode.summary: Whether Dolby Volume mode is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`)

EDID.summary: A base64 encoded byte array string representing the EDID

enhancerlevel.summary: Value between 0 and 16, where 0 means no enhancement and 16 means maximum enhancement

gain.summary: Value between 0 and 100, where 0 means no gain and 100 means maximum gain

level.summary: Value between 0 and 10, where 0 means no level and 10 means maximum level

MISteeringEnable.summary: Whether Media Intelligence Steering is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`)

ms12AudioProfile.summary: An MS12 audio profile name from `getSupportedMS12AudioProfile`

soundMode.summary: Sound mode. Possible values: `AUTO (Dolby Digital Plus)`, `AUTO (Dolby Digital 5.1)`, `AUTO (Stereo)`, `MONO`, `STEREO`, `SURROUND`, PASSTHRU.

standards.summary: A string [] of HDR capabilities. Possible values: `none`, `HDR10`, `Dolby Vision`, `Technicolor Prime`

surroundDecoderEnable.summary: Whether Surround Decoder is is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`)

videoDisplay.summary: Video display port name. The default port is `HDMI0` if no port is specified

volumeLevel.summary: Value between 0 and 100, where 0 means no level and 100 means maximum level

zoomSetting.summary: Zoom setting. Possible values: `FULL`,  `NONE,`  `Letterbox 16x9`, `Letterbox 14x9`, `CCO`, `PanScan`, `Letterbox 2.21 on 4x3`, `Letterbox 2.21 on 16x9`, `Platform`, `Zoom 16x9`, `Pillarbox 4x3`, `Widescreen 4x3`

enableSurroundDecoder.summary:
Enables or disables Surround Decoder capability. The Surround Decoder is an upmixer that takes stereo music content, or surround-encoded two-channel movie content, and creates a high-quality multichannel upmix. If the Surround Decoder is enabled, two-channel signals and 5.1-channel signals are upmixed to 5.1.2.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getActiveInput.summary:
Returns `true` if the STB HDMI output is currently connected to the active input of the sink device (determined by `RxSense`).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

activeInput.summary: `true`:  1. STB is connected to TV's active input 2. Unable to determine if STB is connected to the TV's active input or not (because STB does not support RxSense) ; `false`: 1.STB is not connected to TV's Active input 2. TV is off

getAudioDelay.summary:
Returns the audio delay (in ms) on the selected audio port. If the `audioPort` argument is not specified, it will browse all ports (checking HDMI0 first). If there is no display connected, then it defaults to `HDMI0`.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getAudioDelayOffset.summary:
Returns the audio delay offset (in ms) on the selected audio port. If the `audioPort` argument is not specified, it will browse all ports (checking HDMI0 first). If there is no display connected, then it defaults to `HDMI0`.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getAudioFormat.summary:
Returns the currently set audio format.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getBassEnhancer.summary:
Returns the current status of the Bass Enhancer settings.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` if Bass Enhancer is enabled, otherwise `false`

getConnectedAudioPorts.summary:
Returns connected audio output ports (a subset of the ports supported on the device). For SPDIF supported platforms, SPDIF port is always considered connected. HDMI port may or may not be connected.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

connectedAudioPorts.summary: A string [] of connected audio port names

getConnectedVideoDisplays.summary:
Returns connected video displays.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getCurrentOutputSettings.summary:
Returns current output settings.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

colorDepth.summary: The color depth. The value that is returned from `dsGetCurrentOutputSettings`

getCurrentResolution.summary:
Returns the current resolution on the selected video display port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getDefaultResolution.summary:
Gets the default resolution supported by the HDMI0 video output port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

defaultResolution.summary: Default resolution supported by the HDMI0 video output port

getDialogEnhancement.summary:
Returns the current Dialog Enhancer level (port HDMI0).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` if Dialog Enhancer Mode is enabled, otherwise `false`

getDolbyVolumeMode.summary:
Returns whether Dolby Volume mode is enabled or disabled (audio output port HDMI0).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getDRCMode.summary:
Returns the current Dynamic Range Control mode.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

DRCMode.summary: The DRC Mode value: either `line` or `RF`

getEnableAudioPort.summary:
Returns the current status of the specified input audio port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` if the audio port is enabled, otherwise `false`

getGain.summary:
Returns the current gain value.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getGraphicEqualizerMode.summary:
Returns the current Graphic Equalizer Mode setting (port HDMI0).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` if Graphic Equalizer Mode is enabled, otherwise `false`

mode.summary: Graphic Equalizer mode (`0` = mode not set or in case of error, `1` = open, `2` = rich, `3` = focused)

getIntelligentEqualizerMode.summary:
Returns the current Intelligent Equalizer Mode setting (port HDMI0).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` if Intelligent Equalizer Mode is enabled, otherwise `false`

mode.summary: Intelligent Equalizer mode (`0` = off, `1` = open, `2` = rich, `3` = focused)

getMISteering.summary:
Returns the current status of Media Intelligence Steering settings.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getMS12AudioCompression.summary:
Returns the current audio compression settings.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` if audio compression is enabled, otherwise `false`

getMS12AudioProfile.summary:
Returns the current MS12 audio profile settings.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getMuted.summary:
Returns whether audio is muted on a given port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getPreferredColorDepth.summary:
Returns the current color depth on the selected video display port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getSettopAudioCapabilities.summary:
Returns the set-top audio capabilities for the specified audio port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

AudioCapabilities.summary: An array of audio capabilities supported by STB

items.summary: Audio capability name (None in case of no audio capability support)

getSettopHDRSupport.summary:
Returns an HDR support object (list of standards that the STB supports).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getSettopMS12Capabilities.summary:
Returns the set-top MS12 audio capabilities for the specified audio port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

ms12Capabilities.summary: A string [] of MS12 audio capabilities

getSinkAtmosCapability.summary:
Returns the ATMOS capability of the sink (HDMI0).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

atmos_capability.summary: ATMOS Capability (`0` = off, `1` = open, `2` = rich, `3` = focused)

getSoundMode.summary:
Returns the sound mode for the incoming video display. If the argument is `Null` or empty (although not recommended), this returns the output mode of all connected ports, whichever is connected, while giving priority to the HDMI port. If the video display is not connected, then it returns `Stereo` as a safe default.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getSupportedAudioModes.summary:
Returns a list of strings containing the supported audio modes. If `Null` or empty, this returns the supported audio modes of the audio processor (regardless of the the output port).  
If a port name is specified, this returns the audio output modes supported by the connected sink device (EDID based). If the port is not connected, the return value is same as if `Null` is specified as the parameter.  
For **Auto** mode in DS5, this API has the following extra specification:  
* For HDMI port, this API returns `Stereo` mode, `Dolby Digital 5.1` mode and `Auto` mode; 
* For SPDIF and HDMI ARC port, this API always returns `Surround` mode, `Stereo` mode, and `PASSTHRU` Mode;  
* When `AUTO` mode is returned, it includes in parenthesis the best sound mode that the STB can output and the connected sink device can support, in the format of `AUTO` _(`Best Format`)_. For example, if the connected device supports surround, the auto mode string will be `AUTO (Dolby Digital 5.1)`.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

supportedAudioModes.summary: A string [] of supported audio modes

getSupportedAudioPorts.summary:
Returns all audio ports supported on the device (all ports that are physically present).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

supportedAudioPorts.summary: A string [] of supported audio ports

getSupportedMS12AudioProfiles.summary:
Returns list of platform supported MS12 audio profiles for the specified audio port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

supportedMS12AudioProfiles.summary: A string [] of MS12 audio profiles

getSupportedResolutions.summary:
Returns supported resolutions on the selected video display port (both TV and STB) by its name.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

supportedResolutions.summary: A string array of supported resolutions on the selected video display port

getSupportedSettopResolutions.summary:
Returns supported STB resolutions.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

supportedSettopResolutions.summary: A string array of supported STB resolutions

getSupportedTvResolutions.summary:
Returns supported TV resolutions on the selected video display port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

supportedTvResolutions.summary: A string [] of supported TV resolutions

getSupportedVideoDisplays.summary:
Returns all video ports supported on the device (all ports that are physically present).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

supportedVideoDisplays.summary: a string [] of supported video display ports

getSurroundVirtualizer.summary:
(Version 1) Returns the current surround virtualizer boost settings.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` if Surround Virtualizer is enabled, otherwise `false`

getSurroundVirtualizer.summary:
(Version 2) Returns the current surround virtualizer boost settings.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getTVHDRCapabilities.summary:
Gets HDR capabilities supported by the TV. The following values (OR-ed value) are possible:  
* 0 - HDRSTANDARD_NONE  
* 1 - HDRSTANDARD_HDR10  
* 2 - HDRSTANDARD_HLG  
* 4 - HDRSTANDARD_DolbyVision  
* 8 - HDRSTANDARD_TechnicolorPrime.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

capabilities.summary: The OR-ed value of supported HDR standards by the TV

getTvHDRSupport.summary:
Returns an HDR support object (list of standards that the TV supports).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getVideoFormat.summary:
Returns the current and supported video formats.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getVideoPortStatusInStandby.summary:
Returns video port status in standby mode (failure if the port name is missing).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

videoPortStatusInStandby.summary: video port status (enabled/disabled) in standby mode in case of success

error_message.summary: Error message in case of failure

getVolumeLevel.summary:
Returns the current volume level.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getVolumeLeveller.summary:
(Version 1)Returns the current Volume Leveller setting.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` if Volume Leveller is enabled, otherwise `false`

getVolumeLeveller.summary:
(Version 2) Returns the current Volume Leveller setting.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

getZoomSetting.summary:
Returns the zoom setting value.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

isConnectedDeviceRepeater.summary:
Indicates whether the device connected to the HDMI0 video output port is an HDCP repeater.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

HdcpRepeater.summary: `true` if the device is an HDCP repeater otherwise `false`

isSurroundDecoderEnabled.summary:
Returns the current status of Surround Decoder.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

readEDID.summary:
Reads the EDID from the connected HDMI (output) device. Returns a key of `EDID` with a value of the base64 encoded byte array string representing the EDID.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

readHostEDID.summary:
Reads the EDID of the host. Returns a key of `EDID` with a value of the base64 encoded raw byte array string representing the EDID.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

resetBassEnhancer.summary:
Resets the dialog enhancer level to its default bassboost value.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

resetDialogEnhancement.summary:
Resets the dialog enhancer level to its default enhancer level.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

resetSurroundVirtualizer.summary:
Resets the surround virtualizer to its default boost value.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

resetVolumeLeveller.summary:
Resets the Volume Leveller level to default volume value.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setAudioAtmosOutputMode.summary:
Sets ATMOS audio output mode (on HDMI0).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enable.summary: enable or disable ATMOS audio output mode

setAudioDelay.summary:
Sets the audio delay (in ms) on the selected audio port. If the `audioPort` argument is not specified, it will browse all ports (checking HDMI0 first). If there is no display connected, then it defaults to `HDMI0`.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setAudioDelayOffset.summary:
Sets the audio delay offset (in ms) on the selected audio port. If the `audioPort` argument is not specified, it will browse all ports (checking HDMI0 first). If there is no display connected, then it defaults to `HDMI0`.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setBassEnhancer.summary:
Sets the Bass Enhancer. Bass Enhancer provides the consumer a single control to apply a fixed bass boost to correct for a lack of bass reproduction in the playback system.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setCurrentResolution.summary:
Sets the current resolution.
 
### Events 
| Event | Description | 
| :----------- | :----------- |
| `resolutionPreChange`| Triggered when the resolution of the video display is about to change.|
| `resolutionChanged`| Triggered when the resolution is changed by the user and returns the current resolution.|

ignoreEdid.summary: Ignore the supported resolutions as transmitted by the connected TV EDID

setDialogEnhancement.summary:
Sets the Dialog Enhancer level.A dialog enhancer boosts the speech audio separately from other background content, without increasing the loudness.The method fails if no value is set.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setDolbyVolumeMode.summary:
Enables or disables Dolby Volume mode on audio track (audio output port HDMI0).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setDRCMode.summary:
Sets the Dynamic Range Control (DRC) setting. DRC is a compression control applied to audio to limit the dynamic range to suit a specific listening situation. For default settings, RF mode is preferred for two-channel outputs (television speaker or headphone) and Line mode for multichannel outputs.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

DRCMode.summary: Value of 0 or 1, where 0 is Line mode and 1 is RF mode

setEnableAudioPort.summary:
Enable or disable the specified audio port based on the input audio port name. This feature provides the consumer with a single user control to enable or disable the specified audio port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` enables the specified audio port. `false` disables the specified audio port.

setForceHDRMode.summary:
Enables or disables the force HDR mode. If enabled, the HDR format that is currently configured on the device is used.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

hdr_mode.summary: `true` to force the HDR format or `false` to reset the mode to the default.

setGain.summary:
Adjusts the gain on a specific port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setGraphicEqualizerMode.summary:
Sets the Graphic Equalizer Mode. The Graphic Equalizer is a multi-band equalizer that allows the end user to customize the sonic qualities of the system.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

graphicEqualizerMode.summary: Graphic Equalizer mode (`0` = off, `1` = open, `2` = rich, `3` = focused)

setIntelligentEqualizerMode.summary:
Sets the Intelligent Equalizer Mode (port HDMI0). An Intelligent Equalizer continuously monitors the audio spectrum and adjusts its equalization filter to transform the original audio tone into desired tone.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

intelligentEqualizerMode.summary: Intelligent Equalizer mode (`0` = unset, `1` = open, `2` = rich, `3` = focused)

setMISteering.summary:
Enables or Disables Media Intelligent Steering. Media Intelligence analyzes audio content and steers the Volume Leveler, the Dialogue Enhancer, the Intelligent Equalizer, and the Speaker Virtualizer, based on the type of audio content.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setMS12AudioCompression.summary:
Sets the audio dynamic range compression level (port HDMI0).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setMS12AudioProfile.summary:
Sets the selected MS12 audio profile.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setMS12ProfileSettingsOverride.summary: Overrides individual MS12 audio settings in order to optimize the customer experience (for example, enabling dialog enhancement in sports mode)

profileName.summary: An MS12 audio profile name from `getSupportedMS12AudioProfile`

setMuted.summary:
Mutes or unmutes audio on a specific port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setPreferredColorDepth.summary: Sets the current color depth for the videoDisplay.

setScartParameter.summary:
Sets SCART parameters.  
   
Possible values:  
| **Parameter** | **ParameterData** |  
| `aspect_ratio` | `4x3` or `16x9` |  
| `tv_startup` | `on` or `off` |  
| `rgb` | `on` (disables cvbs) |  
| `cvbs` | `on` (disables rgb) |  
| `macrovision` | not implemented |  
| `cgms` |  `disabled`, `copyNever`, `copyOnce`, `copyFreely`, or `copyNoMore` |  
| `port` | `on` or `off` | 
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setSoundMode.summary:
Sets the current sound mode for the corresponding video display. If the `audioPort` argument value is missing or empty all ports are set.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setSurroundVirtualizer.summary:
(Version 1)Sets the Surround Virtualizer boost. The Speaker/Surround Virtualizer enables a surround sound signal (including one generated by the Surround Decoder) to be rendered over a device with built-in speakers or headphones.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

(Version 2) Sets the Surround Virtualizer boost. The Speaker/Surround Virtualizer enables a surround sound signal (including one generated by the Surround Decoder) to be rendered over a device with built-in speakers or headphones.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setVideoPortStatusInStandby.summary:
Sets the specified video port status to be used in standby mode (failure if the port name is missing).
 
### Event 

 No Events.

enabled.summary: Enable video port status to be used in standby mode

error_message.summary: Error message in case of failure

setVolumeLevel.summary:
Adjusts the Volume Level on a specific port.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setVolumeLeveller.summary:
(Version 1)Sets the Volume Leveller level. Volume Leveller is an advanced volume-control solution that maintains consistent playback levels for content from different sources.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

(Version 2) Sets the Volume Leveller level. Volume Leveller is an advanced volume-control solution that maintains consistent playback levels for content from different sources.
 
### Event 

 No Events.

setZoomSetting.summary:
Sets the current zoom value.
 
### Events 
| Event | Description | 
| :----------- | :----------- |
| `zoomSettingsUpdated`| Triggered when the zoom setting changes and returns the zoom setting values for all video display types.|

getColorDepthCapabilities.summary:
Returns supported color depth capabilities.
 
### Event 

 No Events.
A string array of supported STB color depth capabilities

audioFormatChanged.summary: Triggered when the configured audio format changes

connectedAudioPortUpdated.summary: Triggered when the connected audio port is updated

HotpluggedAudioPort.summary: Audio port ID for which the connection status has changed. Possible audio port IDs are (`HDMI_ARC0`, `HEADPHONE0`,  etc).

isConnected.summary: Current connection status of the audio port

connectedVideoDisplaysUpdated.summary: Triggered when the connected video display is updated and returns the connected video displays.

resolutionChanged.summary: Triggered when the resolution is changed by the user and returns the current resolution

zoomSettingUpdated.summary: Triggered when the zoom setting changes and returns the zoom setting values for all video display types

videoFormatChanged.summary: Triggered when the video format of connected video port changes and returns the new video format along with other supported formats of that video port.
